channel.title: Visual C++ on Richard Millen
channel.description: Recent content in Visual C++ on Richard Millen

item.title: C++ Quiz, Part 2
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: ! W O R K ~ I N ~ P R O G R E S S ! Quiz 1 What is an lvalue? What is an rvalue? What is order of evaluation? What is precedence? What is short-circuit evaluation? Show Answers 1. An expression that yields an object or function. A nonconst lvalue that denotes an object may be the left-hand operand of assignment.

item.title: C++ Quiz, Part 1
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: ! W O R K ~ I N ~ P R O G R E S S ! Quiz 1 Explain why you might want to define your own type-specific swap function? Show Answers 1. 2. Valuelike copy-assignment operator. It is crucially important that the left-hand operand is destroyed and the right-hand operand is copied in a sequence that is correct even if an object is assigned to itself.
